page.title: 11RONS CLIFF DIKE AREA.
page.content: On New Road there are 4 sycamore trees, 3 ash and 2 wild roses. Thereis a footpath which leads around Mill Farm to Rons Cliff Dike. In the dike we caught a fish which was a running water fish. It was about 6 cm. long, slim with a flattened head, hence the name 'Bullhead', we later discovered that it was known locally as the 'Miller's Thumb',( we later released it again). We carried on along the footpath along the dike and noticed a lot of rough grazing. We then walked through a barley field and met a farmer. We asked him some questions. He rents 92 hectares of land from the Cannon Hall Estate. He said most of the fields were grass, rough grazing and barley. His name was Mr.Fletcher and he had 200 cattle, half dairy, half beef. His house was built in 1655.
